channel.title: Ventilator Managment Tutorial
channel.description: Recent content on Ventilator Managment Tutorial

item.title: Breath Types
item.description: Breath types during mechanical ventilation Continous mandatory ventilation In this mode, all breaths are mandatory, and depend soley on the ventilatory settins. They can be either volume-controlled, or pressure controlled. Continous supportive ventilation All breaths are spontanious Intermittent mandatory ventilation Both spontaneious and mandatory breaths are delivered. Deducing ventilation mode vased on breath type graph TD Mandatory[Are mandatory breaths allowed?] Spont[Are spontaneous breath allowed between mandatory breaths?] Mandatory -- No -- CSV Mandatory -- Yes -- Spont Spont -- No -- CMV Spont -- Yes -- IMV

item.title: Clinical Case
item.description: A 22 year old female with history of asthma was admitted to the ED with shortness of breath. Her dyspnea worsened, and she failed to respond to non-invasive therapy. She was ultimately intbuated. The initial ventilation settings were: mode AC/VC, tidal volume 500 ml, respiratory rate 22 per min, PEEP 5 mmHg, Flow 60 L per min. You were called to her bedside as she has been getting progressivly more hypotensive over the past 30 minutes.

item.title: Asthma with Volume Control
item.description: let fs = document.getElementsByTagName('iframe') for (f of fs) { f.frameBorder = 0; f.width = f.parentElement.clientWidth; }

item.title: CMV Pressure-Control
item.description: The constant variable in this mode is the pressure applied to the airway during inspiration. Flow, and volume depend on the pressure as well as on patient-related factors such as the lung compliance, and airway resistance. The ventilator graph below is that of a normal patient on CMV PC. You can change the ventilator settings, and the graph will automatically change. let fs = document.getElementsByTagName('iframe') for (f of fs) { f.
